titles.title: Firearms Safety Research and Development Act of 2000
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an enhanced research credit for the development of smart gun technologies.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/27/2000--Introduced. Firearms Safety Research and Development Act of 2000 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide, for a taxpayer who is a Federal firearms licensee, a smart gun technology credit for the purpose smart gun technology research which is designed to: (1) prevent a firearm from being fired by any individual other than an authorized user of the firearm; and (2) convert the firearm from the inoperable condition to the operable condition in less than one second after contact with either the firearm or the arming device of an authorized user.
